results.title: Ilana Glazer on the Terror of the Modern Birth System and ‘False Positive’
results.abstract: The “Broad City” co-creator starred in and co-wrote a horror film about pregnancy. It’s being released just as she is becoming a mother.

multimedia.caption: Glazer wanted to tell a story about the modern birth process and how it has become commodified: “Everyone is gaslit into thinking it is normal.”

results.title: Lydia Lunch’s Infinite Rebellion
results.abstract: “Good luck figuring me out,” the 62-year-old artist said. A new documentary called “The War Is Never Over” does its best.

results.title: ‘In the Heights’ y el colorismo: lo que se pierde cuando se borra a los afrolatinos
results.abstract: La película, ambientada en un barrio neoyorquino conocido como la Pequeña República Dominicana, no incluyó a latinos de piel oscura en los papeles principales. Críticos y reporteros del Times analizan cómo repercute esa ausencia.
results.byline: By Maira Garcia, Sandra E. Garcia, Isabelia Herrera, Concepción de León, Maya Phillips and A.O. Scott

results.title: ‘In the Heights’ and Colorism: What Is Lost When Afro-Latinos Are Erased
results.abstract: The film, set in a New York neighborhood known as the Little Dominican Republic, didn’t cast dark-skinned Latinos in lead roles. Our writers discuss how that absence reverberates.
results.byline: By Maira Garcia, Sandra E. Garcia, Isabelia Herrera, Concepción de León, Maya Phillips and A.O. Scott
